[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: new()] [Maximum Players] Is there a practical limit on num_players? Could creating configs with millions of players cause memory exhaustion or computational DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: get_share_index()] [Zero Weight Player] If weights[i] = 0, can get_share_index(i, 0) ever return Some? Should zero-weight players be filtered out during initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: reconstruct()] [Empty Shares Vector] What happens if reconstruct() is called with an empty shares vector? Does it fail gracefully or panic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: get_best_case_eligible_subset_of_players()] [All Equal Weights] If all players have equal weight, does best-case vs worst-case make any difference? Could this cause confusion in subset selection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: reconstruct()] [Malicious Share Withholding] Can Byzantine validators with < 1/3 total weight refuse to provide shares, preventing reconstruction even when honest validators have >= threshold weight? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: get_random_eligible_subset_of_players()] [Griefing Attack] Can Byzantine players repeatedly trigger reconstruction with invalid shares, forcing honest validators to waste computation time in failed reconstruction attempts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: new()] [Weight Inflation Attack] Can a Byzantine validator during setup propose inflated weights for colluding validators, enabling them to control reconstruction with < 1/3 of actual validator count? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: get_virtual_player()] [Virtual Player Impersonation] Can Byzantine validators craft fake virtual player IDs to submit shares for players they don't represent, disrupting reconstruction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [All Functions] [Configuration Divergence] If Byzantine validators broadcast different WeightedConfig instances to different honest validators, could this cause permanent network split in PVSS operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: reconstruct()] [Liveness Failure] If reconstruction fails due to bugs in this file, could it prevent distributed key generation (DKG) from completing, halting validator set updates and causing loss of liveness? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: get_random_eligible_subset_of_players()] [Subset Selection Divergence] If different validators select different eligible subsets due to RNG issues, could they fail to coordinate on which validators should participate in reconstruction? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization Disagreement] If validators disagree on the correct WeightedConfig during PVSS setup, could this cause permanent inability to perform DKG, freezing validator set changes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/weighted_config.rs] [Function: get_virtual_player()] [Panic Attack] Can attackers deliberately trigger the assert_lt! at line 168 by providing j >= weight, causing validator panic during normal PVSS operations? (High)
